definition: no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to stop/to prohibit/until/only
border/place/condition/boundary/circumstances/territory

sentences.english: Therefore, our perspective future, knowledge is infinite, achievement foresight.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我们前瞻未来，学无止境，成就远见。

sentences.english: Instead, be open-minded and realize that there will always be more for you to learn.
sentences.chinese: 相反，你应该保持开放心态并认识到学无止境。

sentences.english: Education never ceases, even after we leave school.
sentences.chinese: 学无止境，即使在我们结束学业后也是如此。

sentences.english: I like shoot and come here . Endless learning. I am a student forever.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢摄影而来到这里，学无止境，我永远是学生。

sentences.english: Knowledge has no limits. I wish you to become the very best international basketball referee.
sentences.chinese: 学无止境，祝愿您成为最优秀的国际级篮球裁判员。

sentences.english: We have a long way to labor, because learning is endless.
sentences.chinese: 我们长路漫漫，只因学无止境。

sentences.english: "Live and learn" might be the hardest work out there.
sentences.chinese: “学无止境”是世界上最难做到的事情。

definition: sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
mastery of study lies in diligence (idiom). You can only master a subject by assiduous study./Excellence in work is only possible with diligence./Practice makes perfect.
see 行萬里路，讀萬卷書|行万里路，读万卷书[xing2 wan4 li3 lu4 , du2 wan4 juan4 shu1]
pinyin: du2 wan4 juan4 shu1 , xing2 wan4 li3 lu4

definition: see 藝多不壓身|艺多不压身[yi4 duo1 bu4 ya1 shen1]
it's always good to have more skills (idiom)
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上无难事，只怕有心人

definition: not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
motto/maxim
to learn is to know one's ignorance (the Book of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
pinyin: xue2 ran2 hou4 zhi1 bu4 zu2

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: modest and studious (idiom)
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4
